Anal itching_1:
**Patient Description 1:**
    A 45-year-old male patient presented with a persistent and intense itching sensation in the anal area (rated 7/10 for severity), accompanied by inflammation, burning, and soreness. The symptoms have been ongoing for the last three months and are often exacerbated after bowel movements. The patient reported occasional anal bleeding and stool leakage. He denied any recent changes in bowel habits but mentioned using scented toilet paper. His general health is otherwise stable, with no significant changes. No similar itch has been reported by others in his household. Previous attempts at symptom relief with over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream yielded minimal improvement.
Anal itching_2:
**Patient Description 2:**
    A 35-year-old female patient presented with a chief complaint of persistent anal itching, which she described as intense (rated 8/10 for severity), accompanied by inflammation and a constant burning sensation. The symptoms have been present for the last two months. The patient reported occasional anal bleeding and a feeling of stool leakage. She denied any recent changes in her bowel movements but acknowledged the use of scented soaps and body washes for perineal hygiene. There have been no significant changes in her general health, and no one else in her household experiences a similar itch. The patient attempted to alleviate the symptoms with over-the-counter remedies, but the relief was only temporary.
Anal itching_3:
**Patient Description 3:**
    A 50-year-old male patient presented with a chronic issue of anal itching, characterized by an intense and persistent itchiness (rated 6/10 for severity) in the anal area, along with inflammation and a recurring burning sensation. The symptoms have been ongoing for the past four months and are often associated with anal bleeding and occasional stool leakage. The patient reported no recent changes in bowel habits but admitted to using scented wet wipes for hygiene. There have been no significant alterations in his general health, and no one else in his household experiences a similar itch. The patient had previously tried using over-the-counter creams and ointments without long-term relief.
